title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Budget and Financial Accountability

description.narrative: Assist the Controller and Accountant General's Department (CAGD) in the implementation of Ghana's new integrated financial management information system (GIFMIS); finalize the cash management function within the CAGD using the GIFMIS system; and provide direction and support to both the Ghana Audit Service and the CAGD's Internal Auditor, as these offices transition into an IT auditing role on GIFMIS.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date
Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Andrew Velthaus, Jennifer Lee, and Kelley Vito

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Economic Crimes

description.narrative: Create legislative, regulatory and procedural framework for Anti-Money Laundering/Counter-Terrorist Financing regime. Increase functional expertise and capacity in analysis, investigation, and prosecution. Enhance collection of financial intelligence and analysis capacity through analytical training, mentoring, and developing Financial Intelligence Unit information technology platform. Develop intra-national, regional, and international agreements and exchange. Promote task force approach to investigating and prosecuting cases as well as tracing and confiscating assets from illegal activities. Improve the supervision of banks and regulated entities to ensure AML/CFT laws are fully implemented to protect financial sector from abuse by criminals in concealing and facilitating illegal activities.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date
Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Andrew Velthaus, Jennifer Lee, and Kelley Vito

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Government Debt Issuance and Management

description.narrative: Assist the Ministry of Finance in building institutional capacity for debt issuance and management, and develop policy parameters for structuring national debt and procedures. This includes establishing a debt management unit, ensuring domestic debt sustainability, coordination between the MoF and the Bank of Ghana, building cash forecasting capacity, setting up recording

person-name.narrative: Andrew Velthaus, Jennifer Lee, and Kelley Vito

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Ghana - Banking and Financial Services

description.narrative: In conjunction with the President's Partnership for Growth initiative, OTA's Banking & Financial Services Program is providing technical assistance to the Bank of Ghana to address objectives under the Access to Credit Pillar of Ghana's Joint Country Action Plan (JCAP), including the effectiveness of banking supervision, developing a problem bank resolution framework, and establishing a deposit insurance scheme.

Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Andrew Velthaus, Jennifer Lee, and Kelley Vito

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Ghana - Economic Crimes

description.narrative: Technical assistance has focused on capacity development of the Financial Intelligence Center (FIC), law enforcement offices, and the Bank of Ghana (BoG) supervision unit. In 2013, ECT will continue to aid Ghana as it develops a fully compliant anti-money laundering and counter terrorist financing (AML/CFT) regime.

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Ghana- Budget and Financial Accountability

description.narrative: Assist the Controller and Accountant General's Department (CAGD) on how best to implement the most critical modules of Ghana's new integrated financial management information system (GIFMIS) project, rolled out over its multiple phases and multiple year lifecycle; coordinate resources to finalize the cash management function within the CAGD using the GIFMIS system; provide direction and support to both the Ghana Audit Service and the CAGD's Internal Auditor, as these offices transition into an IT auditing role on GIFMIS.

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Banking and Financial Services

description.narrative: In conjunction with the President's Partnership for Growth initiative, OTA's Banking & Financial Services Program is providing technical assistance to the Bank of Ghana to address objectives under the Access to Credit Pillar of Ghana's Joint Country Action Plan (JCAP), including the effectiveness of banking supervision, developing a problem bank resolution framework, and establishing a deposit insurance scheme.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date
Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Andrew Velthaus, Jennifer Lee, and Kelley Vito

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Ghana - Banking and Financial Services

description.narrative: The intermittent advisor is assisting the Bank of Ghana's Banking Department in developing the capacity to license and supervise electronic money (e-money) issuers. Technical assistance is focusing on the following areas: Assisting the Banking Department to prepare a plan for the development of its Payment Systems Oversight Unit, including staffing patterns, roles and responsibilities, and key tasks to be performed.. Designing an automated reporting framework for the collection and analysis of data from e-money issuers.. Creating a unified national registry of e-money agents, to allow the BoG and e-money issuers to identify agents who represent more than one issuer and facilitate the black listing of agents who commit fraud..

person-name.narrative: Andrew Velthaus, Jennifer Lee, and Kelley Vito

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Economic Crimes - Ghana

description.narrative: Support increased investigative competence of enforcement authorities, to include representatives from the Economic and Organized Crime Office (EOCO), Bureau of National Investigation (BNI) and Criminal Investigation Department (CID). Continue work with the Bank of Ghana to shore-up bank supervision practices, consistent with international standards, while remaining attentive to discrete unmet needs that may remain with regard to supervision of designated non-financial businesses and professions (DNFBPs). Continue long-term technical assistance to the Financial Intelligence Center (FIC) to meet the requirements of the Financial Action Task Force (FATF) and improve institutional competency.

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Revenue Administration and Revenue Policy - Ghana

description.narrative: OTA is providing assistance to the Ghana Revenue Authority on tax crimes investigation to enhance the Legal staff ability to prosecute tax cases; rebuild the Investigations department to identify and investigate criminal tax cases; and refocus the Intelligence Unit to provide actionable information to the GRA operating departments.
